definition: one country, two systems (PRC proposal regarding Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Hong Kong’s return marks the great success of the concept of “one country, two systems.”
sentences.chinese: 香港迴歸祖國，標誌着“一國兩制”構想的巨大成功。

sentences.english: The host's remark: The policy of "One country, two systems" enforced by the Hong Kong SAR is unprecedented in history.
sentences.chinese: 香港特別行政區實施的“一國兩制”政策史無先例。

sentences.english: The concept of "one country, two systems" is a unique contribution made by the Chinese nation to mankind's political development.
sentences.chinese: “一國兩制”是中華民族對人類政治文明的獨特貢獻。

sentences.english: Unprecedentedly, China agreed that the transfer would happen on the basis of “one country, two systems”.
sentences.chinese: 中國同意在一國兩制的基礎上進行改變。

sentences.english: The successful practice of "one country, two systems" has completely convinced the public.
sentences.chinese: “一國兩制”的成功實踐，讓人心悅誠服。

definition: special administrative region/abbr. for 特別行政區|特别行政区
Belt and Road Initiative, Chinese government plan to provide finance and engineering expertise to build infrastructure across Eurasia and northeast Africa, unveiled in 2013
Greater Bay Area, established in 2017, consisting of Hong Kong, Macao and nine cities in Guangdong (abbr. for 粵港澳大灣區|粤港澳大湾区[Yue4 Gang3 Ao4 Da4 wan1 Qu1])
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
